#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail

log_info() { echo "‚ÑπÔ∏è  $*"; }

echo "üìã Active Worktrees:"
echo ""

# Parse git worktree list
feature_count=0
main_path=$(git rev-parse --show-toplevel 2>/dev/null || echo "")

while IFS= read -r line; do
  if [[ "$line" =~ ^worktree[[:space:]](.+)$ ]]; then
    wt_path="${BASH_REMATCH[1]}"

    # Skip main repo
    [[ "$wt_path" == "$main_path" ]] && continue

    # FIXED: Consume the HEAD line before reading branch
    IFS= read -r head_line

    # Now read branch line
    IFS= read -r branch_line
    if [[ "$branch_line" =~ ^branch[[:space:]]refs/heads/(.+)$ ]]; then
      branch="${BASH_REMATCH[1]}"

      # Check if this is a feature worktree
      if [[ "$branch" =~ ^feature/ ]]; then
        feature_count=$((feature_count + 1))

        # Get feature name
        feature_name=$(basename "$wt_path" | sed 's/^feature-//')

        # Get port if exists
        port=""
        if [[ -f "$wt_path/.env.local" ]]; then
          port=$(grep -E "^PORT=" "$wt_path/.env.local" 2>/dev/null | cut -d= -f2 | tr -d ' ' || echo "")
        fi

        # Check if port is in use (prefer nc, fallback lsof)
        port_status="‚ö™Ô∏è"
        if [[ -n "$port" ]]; then
          if command -v nc >/dev/null 2>&1; then
            if nc -z localhost "$port" 2>/dev/null; then
              port_status="üü¢"
            fi
          elif command -v lsof >/dev/null 2>&1; then
            if lsof -Pi ":$port" -sTCP:LISTEN -t >/dev/null 2>&1; then
              port_status="üü¢"
            fi
          fi
        fi

        # Check if path exists
        if [[ -d "$wt_path" ]]; then
          echo "  ‚úÖ $feature_name $(if [[ -n "$port" ]]; then echo "($port_status port $port)"; fi)"
        else
          echo "  ‚ùå $feature_name (path missing)"
        fi

        echo "    Branch: $branch"
        echo "    Path: $wt_path"
        echo ""
      fi
    fi
  fi
done < <(git worktree list --porcelain)

[[ $feature_count -eq 0 ]] && echo "No feature worktrees found."
echo ""

# List function workspaces
workspace_base="$HOME/socialaize-functions-workspace"
if [[ -d "$workspace_base" ]]; then
  workspaces=($(ls -1 "$workspace_base" 2>/dev/null || echo ""))

  if [[ ${#workspaces[@]} -gt 0 ]]; then
    echo "Function Workspaces:"
    for ws in "${workspaces[@]}"; do
      ws_path="$workspace_base/$ws"

      if [[ -f "$ws_path/WORKSPACE_README.md" ]]; then
        # Extract primary function from README
        primary=$(grep "^### Primary Function:" "$ws_path/WORKSPACE_README.md" | head -1 | sed 's/.*: //')

        # Count related functions
        related_count=$(grep -c "^[0-9]\+\. \*\*" "$ws_path/WORKSPACE_README.md" 2>/dev/null || echo "0")

        echo "  ‚Ä¢ $ws"
        [[ -n "$primary" ]] && echo "    Primary: $primary"
        [[ $related_count -gt 0 ]] && echo "    Related functions: $related_count"
      else
        echo "  ‚Ä¢ $ws (no metadata)"
      fi
      echo ""
    done
  fi
fi

echo "üí° Commands:"
echo "  /cleanup-worktree <name>              - Remove a feature worktree"
echo "  /cleanup-functions-workspace <name>   - Remove a function workspace"
echo "  /worktree-status <name>               - Show detailed status"

    10‚Üí
    11‚Üí# ===== Helper Functions =====

    17‚Üí
    18‚Üí# Initialize submodules if present
    19‚Üíinitialize_submodules() {

    24‚Üí  fi

    26‚Üí
    27‚Üí# Get next available port by scanning existing worktrees (RACE-CONDITION SAFE)
    28‚Üíget_next_port() {
    29‚Üí  # Acquire exclusive lock - only one process can run this at a time
    30‚Üí  (
    31‚Üí    # Try flock first, fallback to mkdir
    32‚Üí    if command -v flock >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    33‚Üí      flock -n 200 || {
    34‚Üí        log_error "Another worktree is being created. Please wait and retry."
    35‚Üí        return 1
    36‚Üí      }
    37‚Üí    else
    38‚Üí      # Fallback: atomic mkdir lock
    39‚Üí      local lock_dir="/tmp/socialaize-worktree.lock"
    40‚Üí      # Set trap BEFORE attempting mkdir to ensure cleanup
    41‚Üí      trap 'rmdir "$lock_dir" 2>/dev/null' EXIT RETURN
    42‚Üí
    43‚Üí      if ! mkdir "$lock_dir" 2>/dev/null; then
    44‚Üí        log_error "Another worktree is being created. Please wait and retry."
    45‚Üí        exit 1  # Use exit instead of return to trigger trap
    46‚Üí      fi
    47‚Üí    fi
    48‚Üí
    49‚Üí    # === CRITICAL SECTION START ===
    50‚Üí    local used_ports=()
    51‚Üí
    52‚Üí    # Scan all worktrees for .env.local files
    53‚Üí    while IFS= read -r line; do
    54‚Üí      if [[ "$line" =~ ^worktree[[:space:]](.+)$ ]]; then
    55‚Üí        local wt_path="${BASH_REMATCH[1]}"
    56‚Üí        if [[ -f "$wt_path/.env.local" ]]; then
    57‚Üí          local port=$(grep -E "^PORT=" "$wt_path/.env.local" 2>/dev/null | cut -d= -f2 | tr -d ' ')
    58‚Üí          [[ -n "$port" ]] && used_ports+=("$port")
    59‚Üí        fi
    60‚Üí      fi
    61‚Üí    done < <(git worktree list --porcelain)
    62‚Üí
    63‚Üí    # Find first available port
    64‚Üí    for port in $(seq $PORT_MIN $PORT_MAX); do
    65‚Üí      # Check if port is in used_ports array (optimized with grep)
    66‚Üí      if [[ ${#used_ports[@]} -gt 0 ]] && printf '%s\n' "${used_ports[@]}" | grep -q -w "$port"; then
    67‚Üí        continue
    68‚Üí      fi
    69‚Üí
    70‚Üí      # Optional: Check if port is actually in use (prefer nc, fallback lsof)
    71‚Üí      if command -v nc >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    72‚Üí        if nc -z localhost "$port" 2>/dev/null; then
    73‚Üí          continue
    74‚Üí        fi
    75‚Üí      elif command -v lsof >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    76‚Üí        if lsof -Pi ":$port" -sTCP:LISTEN -t >/dev/null 2>&1; then

    80‚Üí
    81‚Üí      echo "$port"

    84‚Üí

    88‚Üí
    89‚Üí  ) 200>"$LOCK_FILE"

   443‚Üí[[ -n "$PORT" ]] && echo "üîå Dev Server Port: $PORT"

#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail

# ===== Configuration =====
WORKTREE_BASE="$HOME/socialaize-worktrees"
PORT_MIN=6943
PORT_MAX=7020
MAIN_BRANCH="main"
LOCK_FILE="/tmp/socialaize-worktree-port.lock"

# ===== Helper Functions =====

log_info() { echo "‚ÑπÔ∏è  $*"; }
log_success() { echo "‚úÖ $*"; }
log_error() { echo "‚ùå Error: $*" >&2; }
log_warn() { echo "‚ö†Ô∏è  Warning: $*"; }

# Initialize submodules if present
initialize_submodules() {
  local path="$1"
  if [[ -f "$path/.gitmodules" ]]; then
    log_info "Initializing submodules..."
    (cd "$path" && git submodule update --init --recursive)
  fi
}

# Get next available port by scanning existing worktrees (RACE-CONDITION SAFE)
get_next_port() {
  # Acquire exclusive lock - only one process can run this at a time
  (
    # Try flock first, fallback to mkdir
    if command -v flock >/dev/null 2>&1; then
      flock -n 200 || {
        log_error "Another worktree is being created. Please wait and retry."
        return 1
      }
    else
      # Fallback: atomic mkdir lock
      local lock_dir="/tmp/socialaize-worktree.lock"
      # Set trap BEFORE attempting mkdir to ensure cleanup
      trap 'rmdir "$lock_dir" 2>/dev/null' EXIT RETURN

      if ! mkdir "$lock_dir" 2>/dev/null; then
        log_error "Another worktree is being created. Please wait and retry."
        exit 1  # Use exit instead of return to trigger trap
      fi
    fi

    # === CRITICAL SECTION START ===
    local used_ports=()

    # Scan all worktrees for .env.local files
    while IFS= read -r line; do
      if [[ "$line" =~ ^worktree[[:space:]](.+)$ ]]; then
        local wt_path="${BASH_REMATCH[1]}"
        if [[ -f "$wt_path/.env.local" ]]; then
          local port=$(grep -E "^PORT=" "$wt_path/.env.local" 2>/dev/null | cut -d= -f2 | tr -d ' ')
          [[ -n "$port" ]] && used_ports+=("$port")
        fi
      fi
    done < <(git worktree list --porcelain)

    # Find first available port
    for port in $(seq $PORT_MIN $PORT_MAX); do
      # Check if port is in used_ports array (optimized with grep)
      if [[ ${#used_ports[@]} -gt 0 ]] && printf '%s\n' "${used_ports[@]}" | grep -q -w "$port"; then
        continue
      fi

      # Optional: Check if port is actually in use (prefer nc, fallback lsof)
      if command -v nc >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        if nc -z localhost "$port" 2>/dev/null; then
          continue
        fi
      elif command -v lsof >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        if lsof -Pi ":$port" -sTCP:LISTEN -t >/dev/null 2>&1; then
          continue
        fi
      fi

      echo "$port"
      return 0
    done

    log_error "No available ports in range $PORT_MIN-$PORT_MAX"
    return 1
    # === CRITICAL SECTION END ===

  ) 200>"$LOCK_FILE"
}

# Cleanup on failure
cleanup_on_failure() {
  log_error "Creation failed, rolling back..."

  # Remove worktree if created (with safety check)
  [[ -n "${WORKTREE_DIR:-}" ]] && [[ -d "$WORKTREE_DIR" ]] && {
    # Safety: ensure we're deleting inside WORKTREE_BASE
    if [[ "$WORKTREE_DIR" == "$WORKTREE_BASE/"* ]]; then
      git worktree remove "$WORKTREE_DIR" --force 2>/dev/null || rm -rf "$WORKTREE_DIR"
    else
      log_error "Safety check failed: refusing to remove path outside WORKTREE_BASE: $WORKTREE_DIR"
    fi
  }

  # Remove branch if we created it
  [[ -n "${CREATED_BRANCH:-}" ]] && [[ "$CREATED_BRANCH" == "true" ]] && {
    git branch -D "$BRANCH_NAME" 2>/dev/null || true
  }

  log_info "Rollback complete"
  exit 1
}

trap cleanup_on_failure ERR INT TERM

# ===== Parse Arguments =====
FEATURE_NAME="${1:-}"
shift || true

EXISTING_BRANCH=""
TYPE="fullstack"
CUSTOM_PORT=""

while [[ $# -gt 0 ]]; do
  case "$1" in
    --existing-branch)
      EXISTING_BRANCH="$2"
      shift 2
      ;;
    --type)
      TYPE="$2"
      shift 2
      ;;
    --port)
      CUSTOM_PORT="$2"
      shift 2
      ;;
    *)
      log_error "Unknown option: $1"
      exit 1
      ;;
  esac
done

# ===== Validation =====

[[ -z "$FEATURE_NAME" ]] && {
  log_error "Feature name is required"
  echo "Usage: /worktree-feature <feature-name> [--existing-branch <branch>] [--type <frontend|backend|fullstack>] [--port <port>]"
  exit 1
}

# Validate feature name (alphanumeric, hyphens, underscores only)
[[ ! "$FEATURE_NAME" =~ ^[a-zA-Z0-9_-]+$ ]] && {
  log_error "Feature name must contain only letters, numbers, hyphens, and underscores"
  exit 1
}

# Validate type
[[ ! "$TYPE" =~ ^(frontend|backend|fullstack)$ ]] && {
  log_error "Type must be one of: frontend, backend, fullstack"
  exit 1
}

# Ensure we're in a git repo
git rev-parse --git-dir >/dev/null 2>&1 || {
  log_error "Not in a git repository"
  exit 1
}

# Set branch name and validate
if [[ -n "$EXISTING_BRANCH" ]]; then
  # Validate branch name format (security)
  if [[ ! "$EXISTING_BRANCH" =~ ^[a-zA-Z0-9/_-]+$ ]]; then
    log_error "Invalid branch name format. Use only: letters, numbers, hyphens, slashes, underscores"
    exit 1
  fi

  BRANCH_NAME="$EXISTING_BRANCH"
  CREATED_BRANCH="false"

  # Fetch latest remote branches
  log_info "Fetching from origin..."
  git fetch origin 2>/dev/null || log_warn "Could not fetch from remote"

  # Check if branch exists locally OR remotely
  local_exists=false
  remote_exists=false

  if git show-ref --verify --quiet "refs/heads/$BRANCH_NAME"; then
    local_exists=true
  fi

  if git ls-remote --heads origin "$BRANCH_NAME" 2>/dev/null | grep -q "$BRANCH_NAME"; then
    remote_exists=true
  fi

  if [[ "$local_exists" == false ]] && [[ "$remote_exists" == false ]]; then
    log_error "Branch '$BRANCH_NAME' does not exist locally or remotely"
    exit 1
  fi

else
  BRANCH_NAME="feature/${FEATURE_NAME}"
  CREATED_BRANCH="true"
fi

# Set worktree directory
WORKTREE_DIR="$WORKTREE_BASE/feature-${FEATURE_NAME}"

# Check if worktree directory already exists
[[ -d "$WORKTREE_DIR" ]] && {
  log_error "Worktree directory already exists: $WORKTREE_DIR"
  exit 1
}

# Validate custom port
if [[ -n "$CUSTOM_PORT" ]]; then
  [[ ! "$CUSTOM_PORT" =~ ^[0-9]+$ ]] && {
    log_error "Port must be a number"
    exit 1
  }

  [[ "$CUSTOM_PORT" -lt 3000 || "$CUSTOM_PORT" -gt 9999 ]] && {
    log_error "Port must be between 3000-9999"
    exit 1
  }

  # Check if port is in use (prefer nc)
  if command -v nc >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    if nc -z localhost "$CUSTOM_PORT" 2>/dev/null; then
      log_error "Port $CUSTOM_PORT is already in use"
      exit 1
    fi
  elif command -v lsof >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    if lsof -Pi ":$CUSTOM_PORT" -sTCP:LISTEN -t >/dev/null 2>&1; then
      log_error "Port $CUSTOM_PORT is already in use"
      exit 1
    fi
  fi

  PORT="$CUSTOM_PORT"
else
  # Auto-assign port for frontend/fullstack
  if [[ "$TYPE" != "backend" ]]; then
    PORT=$(get_next_port) || exit 1
    log_info "Auto-assigned port: $PORT"
  else
    PORT=""
  fi
fi

# ===== Create Worktree =====

log_info "Creating worktree for feature: $FEATURE_NAME"

# Ensure parent directory exists
mkdir -p "$WORKTREE_BASE"

# Create worktree (FIXED: handle remote-only branches properly)
if [[ "$CREATED_BRANCH" == "true" ]]; then
  # New branch from origin/main
  log_info "Creating new branch: $BRANCH_NAME"
  git worktree add -b "$BRANCH_NAME" "$WORKTREE_DIR" "origin/$MAIN_BRANCH"
else
  # Existing branch - handle local vs remote-only properly
  if [[ "$local_exists" == true ]]; then
    # Local branch exists - just check it out
    log_info "Checking out existing local branch: $BRANCH_NAME"
    git worktree add "$WORKTREE_DIR" "$BRANCH_NAME"
  else
    # Remote-only branch - create local tracking branch FIRST
    log_info "Creating local tracking branch for remote: $BRANCH_NAME"
    git branch --track "$BRANCH_NAME" "origin/$BRANCH_NAME"
    git worktree add "$WORKTREE_DIR" "$BRANCH_NAME"
  fi
fi

# Initialize submodules if present (using helper)
initialize_submodules "$WORKTREE_DIR"

# ===== Configure Worktree =====

# Use subshell to avoid changing directory state
(
  cd "$WORKTREE_DIR"

  # Create .env.local with port (if applicable)
  if [[ -n "$PORT" ]]; then
    cat > .env.local <<EOF
# Worktree-specific configuration
PORT=$PORT
WORKTREE_NAME=$FEATURE_NAME
WORKTREE_TYPE=$TYPE
EOF

    log_success "Created .env.local with PORT=$PORT"
  fi

  # Symlink shared .env from main repo (if it exists)
  MAIN_REPO_PATH=$(git rev-parse --show-toplevel 2>/dev/null || echo "")
  if [[ -n "$MAIN_REPO_PATH" ]] && [[ -f "$MAIN_REPO_PATH/.env" ]]; then
    ln -sf "$MAIN_REPO_PATH/.env" .env.shared
    log_info "Symlinked .env.shared from main repo"
  fi

  # Add to .gitignore (optimized with loop)
  touch .gitignore
  for item in ".env.local" ".env.shared" "WORKTREE_README.md" "*.code-workspace"; do
    grep -qxF "$item" .gitignore 2>/dev/null || echo "$item" >> .gitignore
  done

  # Add pnpm script for dev:worktree (only if not already there)
  if [[ -n "$PORT" ]] && ! grep -q "dev:worktree" package.json 2>/dev/null; then
    pnpm pkg set "scripts.dev:worktree=astro dev --port \${PORT:-6942}" 2>/dev/null || {
      log_warn "Could not add dev:worktree script to package.json"
    }
  fi

  # Create WORKTREE_README.md
  cat > WORKTREE_README.md <<EOF
# Feature: ${FEATURE_NAME}

## Worktree Info
- **Branch**: ${BRANCH_NAME}
- **Type**: ${TYPE}
$(if [[ -n "$PORT" ]]; then echo "- **Port**: ${PORT}"; fi)
- **Created**: $(date -u +"%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S UTC")
- **Path**: ${WORKTREE_DIR}

## Quick Start

### Development
$(if [[ -n "$PORT" ]]; then
  echo "\`\`\`bash
# Start dev server (uses PORT from .env.local)
pnpm dev:worktree

# Or manually specify port
pnpm dev -- --port ${PORT}
\`\`\`"
else
  echo "\`\`\`bash
# Backend - no dev server needed
pnpm test
\`\`\`"
fi)

### Commands
- **Run tests**: \`pnpm test\`
- **Type check**: \`pnpm run typecheck\`
- **Build**: \`pnpm build\`

### Environment Variables
$(if [[ -n "$PORT" ]]; then
  echo "- **.env.local**: Worktree-specific (PORT, WORKTREE_NAME)"
fi)
- **.env.shared**: Symlink to main repo's .env (shared secrets, read-only)
- **Never commit .env.local or .env.shared**

## Merging Back

1. **Ensure tests pass**:
   \`\`\`bash
   pnpm test
   pnpm run typecheck
   \`\`\`

2. **Check for uncommitted changes**:
   \`\`\`bash
   git status
   \`\`\`

3. **Push to remote**:
   \`\`\`bash
   git push origin ${BRANCH_NAME}
   \`\`\`

4. **Create PR**:
   \`\`\`bash
   gh pr create --base main --head ${BRANCH_NAME}
   # Or manually at: https://github.com/YOUR_ORG/socialaize/compare/${BRANCH_NAME}
   \`\`\`

5. **After merge, cleanup**:
   \`\`\`bash
   # From main repo:
   /cleanup-worktree ${FEATURE_NAME}
   # Or manually:
   git worktree remove ${WORKTREE_DIR}
   \`\`\`

## Safety Notes
- ‚ö†Ô∏è DO NOT push directly to main
- ‚ö†Ô∏è Each worktree is independent - changes won't sync automatically
- ‚ö†Ô∏è Shared .env is read-only (symlink) - don't modify in worktree

## Appwrite Functions
If working on functions, remember:
- Each function lives in \`functions-FunctionName\` branch
- Use \`/worktree-functions\` command if you need to modify multiple functions

EOF

  # Create VS Code workspace file
  if [[ -n "$PORT" ]]; then
    cat > "${FEATURE_NAME}.code-workspace" <<EOF
{
  "folders": [
    {
      "path": ".",
      "name": "Feature: ${FEATURE_NAME}"
    }
  ],
  "settings": {
    "astro.devPort": ${PORT},
    "files.exclude": {
      "node_modules": true
    }
  },
  "extensions": {
    "recommendations": [
      "astro-build.astro-vscode",
      "vue.volar"
    ]
  }
}
EOF
  fi
)

# Disable trap on successful completion
trap - ERR INT TERM

# ===== Output Success =====

echo ""
log_success "Worktree created successfully!"
echo ""
echo "üìÅ Location: $WORKTREE_DIR"
echo "üåø Branch: $BRANCH_NAME"
[[ -n "$PORT" ]] && echo "üîå Dev Server Port: $PORT"
echo ""
echo "üöÄ Next Steps:"
echo "1. Open new Claude Code session: code $WORKTREE_DIR"
[[ -n "$PORT" ]] && echo "   Or open workspace: code $WORKTREE_DIR/${FEATURE_NAME}.code-workspace"
[[ -n "$PORT" ]] && echo "2. Start dev server: cd $WORKTREE_DIR && pnpm dev:worktree"
[[ -z "$PORT" ]] && echo "2. Run tests: cd $WORKTREE_DIR && pnpm test"
echo "3. Begin development on feature: $FEATURE_NAME"
echo ""
echo "üí° Tips:"
echo "- See WORKTREE_README.md for full instructions"
[[ -n "$PORT" ]] && echo "- .env.local contains PORT=$PORT"
echo "- .env.shared is symlinked from main repo (read-only)"
echo ""

1‚Üí#!/usr/bin/env bash
     2‚Üíset -euo pipefail
     3‚Üí
     4‚Üílog_info() { echo "‚ÑπÔ∏è  $*"; }
     5‚Üílog_success() { echo "‚úÖ $*"; }
     6‚Üílog_error() { echo "‚ùå Error: $*" >&2; }
     7‚Üílog_warn() { echo "‚ö†Ô∏è  Warning: $*"; }
     8‚Üí
     9‚ÜíFEATURE_NAME="${1:-}"
    10‚ÜíFORCE="${2:-}"
    11‚Üí
    12‚Üí[[ -z "$FEATURE_NAME" ]] && {
    13‚Üí  log_error "Feature name is required"
    14‚Üí  echo "Usage: /cleanup-worktree <feature-name> [--force]"
    15‚Üí  exit 1
    16‚Üí}
    17‚Üí
    18‚ÜíWORKTREE_DIR="$HOME/socialaize-worktrees/feature-${FEATURE_NAME}"
    19‚Üí
    20‚Üí[[ ! -d "$WORKTREE_DIR" ]] && {
    21‚Üí  log_error "Worktree does not exist: $WORKTREE_DIR"
    22‚Üí  exit 1
    23‚Üí}
    24‚Üí
    25‚Üí# Use subshell for safety checks
    26‚Üí(
    27‚Üí  cd "$WORKTREE_DIR"
    28‚Üí
    29‚Üí  # Safety checks (skip if --force)
    30‚Üí  if [[ "$FORCE" != "--force" ]]; then
    31‚Üí
    32‚Üí    # Check 1: Uncommitted changes
    33‚Üí    if [[ -n "$(git status --porcelain)" ]]; then
    34‚Üí      log_error "Worktree has uncommitted changes:"
    35‚Üí      git status --short
    36‚Üí      echo ""
    37‚Üí      echo "Options:"
    38‚Üí      echo "  1. Commit changes: git add . && git commit -m 'message'"
    39‚Üí      echo "  2. Stash changes: git stash"
    40‚Üí      echo "  3. Force cleanup: /cleanup-worktree $FEATURE_NAME --force"
    41‚Üí      exit 1
    42‚Üí    fi
    43‚Üí
    44‚Üí    # Check 2: Unpushed commits
    45‚Üí    branch=$(git rev-parse --abbrev-ref HEAD)
    46‚Üí    local_sha=$(git rev-parse HEAD)
    47‚Üí
    48‚Üí    if ! remote_sha=$(git rev-parse "@{u}" 2>/dev/null); then
    49‚Üí      log_error "Branch has no remote tracking branch - commits only exist locally"
    50‚Üí      echo "Push first: git push -u origin $branch"
    51‚Üí      echo "Or force cleanup: /cleanup-worktree $FEATURE_NAME --force (‚ö†Ô∏è  commits will be lost)"
    52‚Üí      exit 1
    53‚Üí    elif [[ "$local_sha" != "$remote_sha" ]]; then
    54‚Üí      unpushed=$(git log "@{u}..HEAD" --oneline | wc -l | tr -d ' ')
    55‚Üí      if [[ $unpushed -gt 0 ]]; then
    56‚Üí        log_error "Branch has $unpushed unpushed commit(s):"
    57‚Üí        git log "@{u}..HEAD" --oneline
    58‚Üí        echo ""
    59‚Üí        echo "Push first: git push origin $branch"
    60‚Üí        echo "Or force cleanup: /cleanup-worktree $FEATURE_NAME --force (‚ö†Ô∏è  commits will be lost)"
    61‚Üí        exit 1
    62‚Üí      fi
    63‚Üí    fi
    64‚Üí
    65‚Üí    # Check 3: Merged into main?
    66‚Üí    main_branch=$(git symbolic-ref refs/remotes/origin/HEAD 2>/dev/null | sed 's@^refs/remotes/origin/@@' || echo "main")
    67‚Üí    git fetch origin "$main_branch" --quiet 2>/dev/null || true
    68‚Üí
    69‚Üí    if ! git merge-base --is-ancestor HEAD "origin/$main_branch" 2>/dev/null; then
    70‚Üí      log_warn "Branch is not fully merged into $main_branch"
    71‚Üí      echo "Create PR or merge manually before cleanup"
    72‚Üí      echo "Or force cleanup: /cleanup-worktree $FEATURE_NAME --force (‚ö†Ô∏è  unmerged work will be lost)"
    73‚Üí      exit 1
    74‚Üí    fi
    75‚Üí
    76‚Üí    # Check 4: Open PRs?
    77‚Üí    if command -v gh >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    78‚Üí      if gh pr view "$branch" --json state 2>/dev/null | grep -q '"state":"OPEN"'; then
    79‚Üí        log_warn "Branch has an open PR"
    80‚Üí        echo "Close or merge PR before cleanup"
    81‚Üí        echo "Or force cleanup: /cleanup-worktree $FEATURE_NAME --force"
    82‚Üí        exit 1
    83‚Üí      fi
    84‚Üí    fi
    85‚Üí  fi
    86‚Üí)
    87‚Üí
    88‚Üí# All checks passed - proceed with cleanup

#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail

log_info() { echo "‚ÑπÔ∏è  $*"; }
log_success() { echo "‚úÖ $*"; }
log_error() { echo "‚ùå Error: $*" >&2; }
log_warn() { echo "‚ö†Ô∏è  Warning: $*"; }

FEATURE_NAME="${1:-}"
FORCE="${2:-}"

[[ -z "$FEATURE_NAME" ]] && {
  log_error "Feature name is required"
  echo "Usage: /cleanup-worktree <feature-name> [--force]"
  exit 1
}

WORKTREE_DIR="$HOME/socialaize-worktrees/feature-${FEATURE_NAME}"

[[ ! -d "$WORKTREE_DIR" ]] && {
  log_error "Worktree does not exist: $WORKTREE_DIR"
  exit 1
}

# Use subshell for safety checks
(
  cd "$WORKTREE_DIR"

  # Safety checks (skip if --force)
  if [[ "$FORCE" != "--force" ]]; then

    # Check 1: Uncommitted changes
    if [[ -n "$(git status --porcelain)" ]]; then
      log_error "Worktree has uncommitted changes:"
      git status --short
      echo ""
      echo "Options:"
      echo "  1. Commit changes: git add . && git commit -m 'message'"
      echo "  2. Stash changes: git stash"
      echo "  3. Force cleanup: /cleanup-worktree $FEATURE_NAME --force"
      exit 1
    fi

    # Check 2: Unpushed commits
    branch=$(git rev-parse --abbrev-ref HEAD)
    local_sha=$(git rev-parse HEAD)

    if ! remote_sha=$(git rev-parse "@{u}" 2>/dev/null); then
      log_error "Branch has no remote tracking branch - commits only exist locally"
      echo "Push first: git push -u origin $branch"
      echo "Or force cleanup: /cleanup-worktree $FEATURE_NAME --force (‚ö†Ô∏è  commits will be lost)"
      exit 1
    elif [[ "$local_sha" != "$remote_sha" ]]; then
      unpushed=$(git log "@{u}..HEAD" --oneline | wc -l | tr -d ' ')
      if [[ $unpushed -gt 0 ]]; then
        log_error "Branch has $unpushed unpushed commit(s):"
        git log "@{u}..HEAD" --oneline
        echo ""
        echo "Push first: git push origin $branch"
        echo "Or force cleanup: /cleanup-worktree $FEATURE_NAME --force (‚ö†Ô∏è  commits will be lost)"
        exit 1
      fi
    fi

    # Check 3: Merged into main?
    main_branch=$(git symbolic-ref refs/remotes/origin/HEAD 2>/dev/null | sed 's@^refs/remotes/origin/@@' || echo "main")
    git fetch origin "$main_branch" --quiet 2>/dev/null || true

    if ! git merge-base --is-ancestor HEAD "origin/$main_branch" 2>/dev/null; then
      log_warn "Branch is not fully merged into $main_branch"
      echo "Create PR or merge manually before cleanup"
      echo "Or force cleanup: /cleanup-worktree $FEATURE_NAME --force (‚ö†Ô∏è  unmerged work will be lost)"
      exit 1
    fi

    # Check 4: Open PRs?
    if command -v gh >/dev/null 2>&1; then
      if gh pr view "$branch" --json state 2>/dev/null | grep -q '"state":"OPEN"'; then
        log_warn "Branch has an open PR"
        echo "Close or merge PR before cleanup"
        echo "Or force cleanup: /cleanup-worktree $FEATURE_NAME --force"
        exit 1
      fi
    fi
  fi
)

# All checks passed - proceed with cleanup
log_info "Removing worktree: $WORKTREE_DIR"
git worktree remove "$WORKTREE_DIR" || {
  log_error "Failed to remove worktree, trying force remove..."
  git worktree remove "$WORKTREE_DIR" --force
}

log_success "Worktree removed: $FEATURE_NAME"

# Get branch name for instructions
branch=$(cd "$WORKTREE_DIR" 2>/dev/null && git rev-parse --abbrev-ref HEAD || echo "feature/${FEATURE_NAME}")
log_info "Branch still exists locally and remotely"
log_info "Delete branch: git branch -d $branch && git push origin --delete $branch"

#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail

FEATURE_NAME="${1:-}"

[[ -z "$FEATURE_NAME" ]] && {
  echo "‚ùå Error: Feature name is required"
  echo "Usage: /worktree-status <feature-name>"
  exit 1
}

WORKTREE_DIR="$HOME/socialaize-worktrees/feature-${FEATURE_NAME}"

[[ ! -d "$WORKTREE_DIR" ]] && {
  echo "‚ùå Error: Worktree does not exist: $WORKTREE_DIR"
  exit 1
}

# Use subshell to avoid changing directory state
(
  cd "$WORKTREE_DIR"

  echo "üîç Worktree: $FEATURE_NAME"
  echo ""

  # Branch info
  branch=$(git rev-parse --abbrev-ref HEAD)
  echo "üìä Status:"
  echo "  ‚úÖ Branch: $branch"

  # Working tree status
  if [[ -z "$(git status --porcelain)" ]]; then
    echo "  ‚úÖ Clean working tree: No uncommitted changes"
  else
    modified=$(git status --porcelain | wc -l | tr -d ' ')
    echo "  ‚ö†Ô∏è  Modified files: $modified"
    git status --short | sed 's/^/     /'
  fi

  # Sync status with remote
  if remote_sha=$(git rev-parse "@{u}" 2>/dev/null); then
    local_sha=$(git rev-parse HEAD)

    if [[ "$local_sha" == "$remote_sha" ]]; then
      echo "  ‚úÖ In sync with remote"
    else
      behind=$(git rev-list --count HEAD..@{u} 2>/dev/null || echo "0")
      ahead=$(git rev-list --count @{u}..HEAD 2>/dev/null || echo "0")

      [[ $behind -gt 0 ]] && echo "  ‚ö†Ô∏è  Behind remote: $behind commit(s)"
      [[ $ahead -gt 0 ]] && echo "  üì§ Ahead of remote: $ahead commit(s)"
    fi
  else
    echo "  ‚ö†Ô∏è  No remote tracking branch"
  fi

  # Dev server status
  if [[ -f ".env.local" ]]; then
    port=$(grep -E "^PORT=" .env.local 2>/dev/null | cut -d= -f2 | tr -d ' ' || echo "")

    if [[ -n "$port" ]]; then
      # Prefer nc, fallback lsof
      if command -v nc >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        if nc -z localhost "$port" 2>/dev/null; then
          echo "  üì¶ Dev server: Running on port $port"
        else
          echo "  üì¶ Dev server: Not running (port $port assigned)"
        fi
      elif command -v lsof >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        if pid=$(lsof -ti ":$port" 2>/dev/null); then
          echo "  üì¶ Dev server: Running on port $port (PID: $pid)"
        else
          echo "  üì¶ Dev server: Not running (port $port assigned)"
        fi
      else
        echo "  üì¶ Dev server: Port $port assigned (nc/lsof not available to check status)"
      fi
    fi
  fi

  echo ""

  # Stats
  main_branch=$(git symbolic-ref refs/remotes/origin/HEAD 2>/dev/null | sed 's@^refs/remotes/origin/@@' || echo "main")

  commits_ahead=$(git rev-list --count "origin/$main_branch..HEAD" 2>/dev/null || echo "0")
  files_changed=$(git diff --name-only "origin/$main_branch...HEAD" 2>/dev/null | wc -l | tr -d ' ')
  last_commit=$(git log -1 --format="%cr" 2>/dev/null || echo "unknown")

  echo "üìà Stats:"
  echo "  ‚Ä¢ Files changed: $files_changed"
  echo "  ‚Ä¢ Commits ahead of $main_branch: $commits_ahead"
  echo "  ‚Ä¢ Last commit: $last_commit"

  # PR status
  if command -v gh >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    if pr_info=$(gh pr view "$branch" --json number,title,state 2>/dev/null); then
      pr_num=$(echo "$pr_info" | grep -o '"number":[0-9]*' | cut -d: -f2)
      pr_state=$(echo "$pr_info" | grep -o '"state":"[^"]*"' | cut -d'"' -f4)
      pr_title=$(echo "$pr_info" | grep -o '"title":"[^"]*"' | cut -d'"' -f4)

      echo ""
      echo "üîó Related PR:"
      echo "  ‚Ä¢ #$pr_num ($pr_state) - $pr_title"
    fi
  fi

  echo ""
  echo "üí° Next Steps:"

  [[ -n "$(git status --porcelain)" ]] && echo "  ‚Ä¢ Commit changes: git add . && git commit -m 'message'"

  if [[ -n "${remote_sha:-}" ]] && [[ "$local_sha" != "$remote_sha" ]]; then
    ahead=$(git rev-list --count @{u}..HEAD 2>/dev/null || echo "0")
    [[ $ahead -gt 0 ]] && echo "  ‚Ä¢ Push changes: git push origin $branch"

    behind=$(git rev-list --count HEAD..@{u} 2>/dev/null || echo "0")
    [[ $behind -gt 0 ]] && echo "  ‚Ä¢ Pull latest: git pull origin $branch"
  fi

  if command -v gh >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    if ! gh pr view "$branch" --json state >/dev/null 2>&1; then
      echo "  ‚Ä¢ Create PR: gh pr create --base main --head $branch"
    fi
  fi
)

1‚Üí#!/usr/bin/env bash
     2‚Üíset -euo pipefail
     3‚Üí
     4‚Üí# ===== Configuration =====
     5‚ÜíWORKSPACE_BASE="$HOME/socialaize-functions-workspace"
     6‚Üí
     7‚Üí# ===== Helper Functions =====
     8‚Üí
     9‚Üílog_info() { echo "‚ÑπÔ∏è  $*"; }
    10‚Üílog_success() { echo "‚úÖ $*"; }
    11‚Üílog_error() { echo "‚ùå Error: $*" >&2; }
    12‚Üílog_warn() { echo "‚ö†Ô∏è  Warning: $*"; }
    13‚Üí
    14‚Üí# Initialize submodules if present
    15‚Üíinitialize_submodules() {
    16‚Üí  local path="$1"
    17‚Üí  if [[ -f "$path/.gitmodules" ]]; then
    18‚Üí    log_info "Initializing submodules..."
    19‚Üí    (cd "$path" && git submodule update --init --recursive)
    20‚Üí  fi
    21‚Üí}
    22‚Üí
    23‚Üí# Cleanup on failure
    24‚Üícleanup_on_failure() {
    25‚Üí  log_error "Creation failed, rolling back..."
    26‚Üí
    27‚Üí  # Remove all created worktrees
    28‚Üí  for wt in "${CREATED_WORKTREES[@]}"; do
    29‚Üí    [[ -d "$wt" ]] && git worktree remove "$wt" --force 2>/dev/null
    30‚Üí  done
    31‚Üí
    32‚Üí  # Remove workspace directory (with safety check)
    33‚Üí  if [[ -n "${WORKSPACE_DIR:-}" ]] && [[ -d "$WORKSPACE_DIR" ]]; then
    34‚Üí    if [[ "$WORKSPACE_DIR" == "$WORKSPACE_BASE/"* ]]; then
    35‚Üí      rm -rf "$WORKSPACE_DIR"
    36‚Üí    else
    37‚Üí      log_error "Safety check failed: refusing to remove path outside WORKSPACE_BASE"
    38‚Üí    fi
    39‚Üí  fi
    40‚Üí
    41‚Üí  log_info "Rollback complete"
    42‚Üí  exit 1
    43‚Üí}
    44‚Üí
    45‚Üítrap cleanup_on_failure ERR INT TERM
    46‚Üí
    47‚Üí# ===== Parse Arguments =====
    48‚Üí
    49‚ÜíPRIMARY_FUNCTION="${1:-}"
    50‚Üíshift || true
    51‚Üí
    52‚ÜíRELATED_FUNCTIONS=()
    53‚ÜíCUSTOM_WORKSPACE_NAME=""
    54‚Üí
    55‚Üíwhile [[ $# -gt 0 ]]; do
    56‚Üí  case "$1" in
    57‚Üí    --workspace-name)
    58‚Üí      CUSTOM_WORKSPACE_NAME="$2"
    59‚Üí      shift 2
    60‚Üí      ;;
    61‚Üí    *)
    62‚Üí      RELATED_FUNCTIONS+=("$1")
    63‚Üí      shift
    64‚Üí      ;;
    65‚Üí  esac
    66‚Üídone
    67‚Üí
    68‚Üí# ===== Validation =====
    69‚Üí
    70‚Üí[[ -z "$PRIMARY_FUNCTION" ]] && {
    71‚Üí  log_error "Primary function name is required"
    72‚Üí  echo "Usage: /worktree-functions <primary-function> [related-functions...] [--workspace-name <name>]"
    73‚Üí  exit 1
    74‚Üí}
    75‚Üí
    76‚Üí# Ensure we're in a git repo
    77‚Üígit rev-parse --git-dir >/dev/null 2>&1 || {
    78‚Üí  log_error "Not in a git repository"
    79‚Üí  exit 1
    80‚Üí}
    81‚Üí
    82‚Üí# Set workspace name
    83‚Üíif [[ -n "$CUSTOM_WORKSPACE_NAME" ]]; then
    84‚Üí  WORKSPACE_NAME="$CUSTOM_WORKSPACE_NAME"
    85‚Üíelse
    86‚Üí  WORKSPACE_NAME="$PRIMARY_FUNCTION"
    87‚Üífi
    88‚Üí
    89‚ÜíWORKSPACE_DIR="$WORKSPACE_BASE/$WORKSPACE_NAME"
    90‚Üí
    91‚Üí# Check if workspace already exists
    92‚Üí[[ -d "$WORKSPACE_DIR" ]] && {
    93‚Üí  log_error "Workspace already exists: $WORKSPACE_DIR"
    94‚Üí  log_info "Use --workspace-name with a different name or run: /cleanup-functions-workspace $WORKSPACE_NAME"
    95‚Üí  exit 1
    96‚Üí}
    97‚Üí
    98‚Üí# Fetch from remote to ensure we have latest branches
    99‚Üílog_info "Fetching from origin..."
   100‚Üígit fetch origin 2>/dev/null || log_warn "Could not fetch from remote, using local branches"
   101‚Üí
   102‚Üí# Validate all function branches exist
   103‚ÜíALL_FUNCTIONS=("$PRIMARY_FUNCTION" "${RELATED_FUNCTIONS[@]}")
   104‚Üí
   105‚Üífor func in "${ALL_FUNCTIONS[@]}"; do
   106‚Üí  branch="functions-$func"
   107‚Üí
   108‚Üí  # Check if branch exists locally or remotely
   109‚Üí  if ! git show-ref --verify --quiet "refs/heads/$branch"; then
   110‚Üí    # Not local, check remote
   111‚Üí    if ! git ls-remote --heads origin "$branch" 2>/dev/null | grep -q "$branch"; then
   112‚Üí      log_error "Branch '$branch' does not exist locally or remotely"
   113‚Üí      echo ""
   114‚Üí      echo "Available function branches:"
   115‚Üí      git branch -r | grep "origin/functions-" | sed 's|.*/functions-||' | sed 's/^/  - /'
   116‚Üí      exit 1
   117‚Üí    else
   118‚Üí      # Exists remotely but not locally - create tracking branch
   119‚Üí      log_info "Creating local tracking branch for $branch"
   120‚Üí      git branch --track "$branch" "origin/$branch" 2>/dev/null || true
   121‚Üí    fi
   122‚Üí  fi
   123‚Üídone
   124‚Üí
   125‚Üí# Warn about out-of-sync branches
   126‚Üífor func in "${ALL_FUNCTIONS[@]}"; do
   127‚Üí  branch="functions-$func"
   128‚Üí
   129‚Üí  if git show-ref --verify --quiet "refs/heads/$branch"; then
   130‚Üí    local_sha=$(git rev-parse "$branch" 2>/dev/null)
   131‚Üí    remote_sha=$(git rev-parse "origin/$branch" 2>/dev/null || echo "")
   132‚Üí
   133‚Üí    if [[ -n "$remote_sha" ]] && [[ "$local_sha" != "$remote_sha" ]]; then
   134‚Üí      log_warn "Branch '$branch' is out of sync with remote"
   135‚Üí      log_info "  Local:  $local_sha"
   136‚Üí      log_info "  Remote: $remote_sha"
   137‚Üí      log_info "  Consider: git pull origin $branch"
   138‚Üí    fi
   139‚Üí  fi
   140‚Üídone
   141‚Üí
   142‚Üí# ===== Create Workspace =====
   143‚Üí
   144‚Üílog_info "Creating functions workspace: $WORKSPACE_NAME"
   145‚Üímkdir -p "$WORKSPACE_DIR"
   146‚Üí
   147‚ÜíCREATED_WORKTREES=()
   148‚Üí
   149‚Üí# Create worktree for primary function
   150‚ÜíPRIMARY_PATH="$WORKSPACE_DIR/$PRIMARY_FUNCTION"
   151‚Üílog_info "Creating worktree for primary function: $PRIMARY_FUNCTION"
   152‚Üígit worktree add "$PRIMARY_PATH" "functions-$PRIMARY_FUNCTION"
   153‚ÜíCREATED_WORKTREES+=("$PRIMARY_PATH")
   154‚Üí
   155‚Üí# Initialize submodules (using helper)
   156‚Üíinitialize_submodules "$PRIMARY_PATH"
   157‚Üí
   158‚Üí# Create worktrees for related functions
   159‚Üífor func in "${RELATED_FUNCTIONS[@]}"; do
   160‚Üí  func_path="$WORKSPACE_DIR/$func"
   161‚Üí  log_info "Creating worktree for related function: $func"
   162‚Üí  git worktree add "$func_path" "functions-$func"
   163‚Üí  CREATED_WORKTREES+=("$func_path")
   164‚Üí
   165‚Üí  # Initialize submodules (using helper)
   166‚Üí  initialize_submodules "$func_path"
   167‚Üídone
   168‚Üí
   169‚Üí# ===== Create Workspace Documentation =====
   170‚Üí
   171‚Üí# Detect entry point for a function
   172‚Üídetect_entry_point() {
   173‚Üí  local func_path="$1"
   174‚Üí  local func_name="$2"
   175‚Üí  local possible_entries=(
   176‚Üí    "src/main.ts"
   177‚Üí    "src/main.js"
   178‚Üí    "src/index.ts"
   179‚Üí    "src/index.js"
   180‚Üí    "main.ts"
   181‚Üí    "index.ts"
   182‚Üí  )
   183‚Üí
   184‚Üí  for entry in "${possible_entries[@]}"; do
   185‚Üí    if [[ -f "$func_path/functions/$func_name/$entry" ]]; then
   186‚Üí      echo "$entry"
   187‚Üí      return 0
   188‚Üí    fi
   189‚Üí  done
   190‚Üí
   191‚Üí  echo "src/main.ts"  # fallback
   192‚Üí}
   193‚Üí
   194‚Üí# Detect package manager
   195‚Üídetect_package_manager() {
   196‚Üí  local func_path="$1"
   197‚Üí  local func_name="$2"
   198‚Üí
   199‚Üí  if [[ -f "$func_path/functions/$func_name/package-lock.json" ]]; then
   200‚Üí    echo "npm"
   201‚Üí  elif [[ -f "$func_path/functions/$func_name/pnpm-lock.yaml" ]]; then
   202‚Üí    echo "pnpm"
   203‚Üí  elif [[ -f "$func_path/functions/$func_name/yarn.lock" ]]; then
   204‚Üí    echo "yarn"
   205‚Üí  else
   206‚Üí    echo "npm"  # default
   207‚Üí  fi
   208‚Üí}
   209‚Üí
   210‚Üí# Create workspace README
   211‚Üícat > "$WORKSPACE_DIR/WORKSPACE_README.md" <<EOF
   212‚Üí# Functions Workspace: ${WORKSPACE_NAME}
   213‚Üí
   214‚ÜíYou are working in a multi-function workspace. Each function lives in its own worktree checked out from its dedicated branch.
   215‚Üí
   216‚Üí## Workspace Structure
   217‚Üí
   218‚Üí### Primary Function: ${PRIMARY_FUNCTION}
   219‚Üí- **Path**: ${PRIMARY_PATH}
   220‚Üí- **Branch**: functions-${PRIMARY_FUNCTION}
   221‚Üí- **Function Code**: functions/${PRIMARY_FUNCTION}/
   222‚Üí- **Main Entry**: $(detect_entry_point "$PRIMARY_PATH" "$PRIMARY_FUNCTION")
   223‚Üí- **Package Manager**: $(detect_package_manager "$PRIMARY_PATH" "$PRIMARY_FUNCTION")
   224‚Üí
   225‚Üí$(if [[ ${#RELATED_FUNCTIONS[@]} -gt 0 ]]; then
   226‚Üí  echo "### Related Functions"
   227‚Üí  for func in "${RELATED_FUNCTIONS[@]}"; do
   228‚Üí    func_path="$WORKSPACE_DIR/$func"
   229‚Üí    echo "${func_num:-1}. **${func}**"
   230‚Üí    echo "   - Path: ${func_path}"
   231‚Üí    echo "   - Branch: functions-${func}"
   232‚Üí    echo "   - Function Code: functions/${func}/"
   233‚Üí    echo "   - Main Entry: $(detect_entry_point "$func_path" "$func")"
   234‚Üí    echo "   - Package Manager: $(detect_package_manager "$func_path" "$func")"
   235‚Üí    echo ""
   236‚Üí  done
   237‚Üífi)
   238‚Üí
   239‚Üí## How to Work in This Workspace
   240‚Üí
   241‚Üí### Reading Files
   242‚ÜíUse absolute paths from the workspace:
   243‚Üí
   244‚Üí\`\`\`typescript
   245‚Üí// Read primary function
   246‚ÜíRead("${PRIMARY_PATH}/functions/${PRIMARY_FUNCTION}/$(detect_entry_point "$PRIMARY_PATH" "$PRIMARY_FUNCTION")")
   247‚Üí
   248‚Üí$(for func in "${RELATED_FUNCTIONS[@]}"; do
   249‚Üí  func_path="$WORKSPACE_DIR/$func"
   250‚Üí  echo "// Read ${func}"
   251‚Üí  echo "Read(\"${func_path}/functions/${func}/$(detect_entry_point "$func_path" "$func")\")"
   252‚Üí  echo ""
   253‚Üídone)
   254‚Üí\`\`\`
   255‚Üí
   256‚Üí### Editing Files
   257‚ÜíEdit files in their respective worktree directories:
   258‚Üí
   259‚Üí\`\`\`typescript
   260‚ÜíEdit(
   261‚Üí  "${PRIMARY_PATH}/functions/${PRIMARY_FUNCTION}/src/handlers/example.ts",
   262‚Üí  oldCode,
   263‚Üí  newCode
   264‚Üí)
   265‚Üí\`\`\`
   266‚Üí
   267‚Üí### Building Functions
   268‚ÜíEach function must be built in its own worktree:
   269‚Üí
   270‚Üí\`\`\`bash
   271‚Üí# Build ${PRIMARY_FUNCTION}
   272‚Üícd ${PRIMARY_PATH}
   273‚Üí$(detect_package_manager "$PRIMARY_PATH" "$PRIMARY_FUNCTION") install  # First time only
   274‚Üí$(detect_package_manager "$PRIMARY_PATH" "$PRIMARY_FUNCTION") run build
   275‚Üí
   276‚Üí$(for func in "${RELATED_FUNCTIONS[@]}"; do
   277‚Üí  func_path="$WORKSPACE_DIR/$func"
   278‚Üí  pm=$(detect_package_manager "$func_path" "$func")
   279‚Üí  echo "# Build ${func}"
   280‚Üí  echo "cd ${func_path}"
   281‚Üí  echo "$pm install  # First time only"
   282‚Üí  echo "$pm run build"
   283‚Üí  echo ""
   284‚Üídone)
   285‚Üí\`\`\`
   286‚Üí
   287‚Üí### Testing Functions
   288‚Üí
   289‚Üí\`\`\`bash
   290‚Üí# Test ${PRIMARY_FUNCTION}
   291‚Üícd ${PRIMARY_PATH}
   292‚Üí$(detect_package_manager "$PRIMARY_PATH" "$PRIMARY_FUNCTION") test
   293‚Üí
   294‚Üí$(for func in "${RELATED_FUNCTIONS[@]}"; do
   295‚Üí  func_path="$WORKSPACE_DIR/$func"
   296‚Üí  pm=$(detect_package_manager "$func_path" "$func")
   297‚Üí  echo "# Test ${func}"
   298‚Üí  echo "cd ${func_path}"
   299‚Üí  echo "$pm test"
   300‚Üí  echo ""
   301‚Üídone)
   302‚Üí\`\`\`
   303‚Üí
   304‚Üí### Committing Changes
   305‚Üí**IMPORTANT**: Commit changes in each worktree separately to their respective branches.
   306‚Üí
   307‚Üí\`\`\`bash
   308‚Üí# Commit ${PRIMARY_FUNCTION} changes
   309‚Üícd ${PRIMARY_PATH}
   310‚Üígit add functions/${PRIMARY_FUNCTION}/
   311‚Üígit commit -m "feat(${PRIMARY_FUNCTION}): description"
   312‚Üígit push origin functions-${PRIMARY_FUNCTION}
   313‚Üí
   314‚Üí$(for func in "${RELATED_FUNCTIONS[@]}"; do
   315‚Üí  func_path="$WORKSPACE_DIR/$func"
   316‚Üí  echo "# Commit ${func} changes"
   317‚Üí  echo "cd ${func_path}"
   318‚Üí  echo "git add functions/${func}/"
   319‚Üí  echo "git commit -m \"feat(${func}): description\""
   320‚Üí  echo "git push origin functions-${func}"
   321‚Üí  echo ""
   322‚Üídone)
   323‚Üí\`\`\`
   324‚Üí
   325‚Üí### Creating Pull Requests
   326‚ÜíCreate **separate PRs** for each function branch:
   327‚Üí
   328‚Üí\`\`\`bash
   329‚Üí# PR for ${PRIMARY_FUNCTION}
   330‚Üícd ${PRIMARY_PATH}
   331‚Üígh pr create --base main --head functions-${PRIMARY_FUNCTION} --title "feat(${PRIMARY_FUNCTION}): description"
   332‚Üí
   333‚Üí$(for func in "${RELATED_FUNCTIONS[@]}"; do
   334‚Üí  func_path="$WORKSPACE_DIR/$func"
   335‚Üí  echo "# PR for ${func}"
   336‚Üí  echo "cd ${func_path}"
   337‚Üí  echo "gh pr create --base main --head functions-${func} --title \"feat(${func}): description\""
   338‚Üí  echo ""
   339‚Üídone)
   340‚Üí\`\`\`
   341‚Üí
   342‚Üí## Important Notes
   343‚Üí- Each worktree is on a **DIFFERENT branch** (functions-FunctionName)
   344‚Üí- Changes to one function do **NOT** affect others until merged
   345‚Üí- After completing work, create **separate PRs** for each function branch
   346‚Üí- **DO NOT push directly to main branch**
   347‚Üí- Always build before committing to catch errors
   348‚Üí- When done, clean up with: \`/cleanup-functions-workspace ${WORKSPACE_NAME}\`
   349‚Üí
   350‚Üí## Quick Reference
   351‚Üí- Workspace: ${WORKSPACE_DIR}
   352‚Üí- Primary: ${PRIMARY_FUNCTION} ‚Üí ${PRIMARY_PATH}
   353‚Üí$(for func in "${RELATED_FUNCTIONS[@]}"; do
   354‚Üí  echo "- Related: ${func} ‚Üí ${WORKSPACE_DIR}/${func}"
   355‚Üídone)
   356‚Üí
   357‚ÜíEOF
   358‚Üí
   359‚Üí# Disable trap on successful completion
   360‚Üítrap - ERR INT TERM
   361‚Üí
   362‚Üí# ===== Output Success =====
   363‚Üí
   364‚Üíecho ""
   365‚Üílog_success "Functions workspace created!"
   366‚Üíecho ""
   367‚Üíecho "üì¶ Workspace: $WORKSPACE_NAME"
   368‚Üíecho "üìÅ Location: $WORKSPACE_DIR"
   369‚Üíecho ""
   370‚Üíecho "üéØ Primary Function: $PRIMARY_FUNCTION"
   371‚Üíecho "   Branch: functions-$PRIMARY_FUNCTION"
   372‚Üíecho "   Path: $PRIMARY_PATH/functions/$PRIMARY_FUNCTION/"
   373‚Üíecho ""
   374‚Üí
   375‚Üíif [[ ${#RELATED_FUNCTIONS[@]} -gt 0 ]]; then
   376‚Üí  echo "üîó Related Functions:"
   377‚Üí  for func in "${RELATED_FUNCTIONS[@]}"; do
   378‚Üí    echo "   ‚Ä¢ $func (functions-$func)"
   379‚Üí    echo "     Path: $WORKSPACE_DIR/$func/functions/$func/"
   380‚Üí  done
   381‚Üí  echo ""
   382‚Üífi
   383‚Üí
   384‚Üíecho "üìã Context loaded for Claude:"
   385‚Üíecho "   ‚Ä¢ Workspace README: WORKSPACE_README.md"
   386‚Üíecho "   ‚Ä¢ Build/commit instructions ready"
   387‚Üíecho ""
   388‚Üíecho "üí° How to use:"
   389‚Üíecho "1. Claude can now read/edit files across all function worktrees"
   390‚Üíecho "2. Each function builds independently: cd <function-path> && npm run build"
   391‚Üíecho "3. Commit changes per-function (separate branches)"
   392‚Üíecho "4. Create separate PRs for each modified function"
   393‚Üíecho ""
   394‚Üíecho "‚ö†Ô∏è  Remember:"
   395‚Üíecho "- Changes in one worktree don't affect others"
   396‚Üíecho "- Each function is on its own branch (functions-FunctionName)"
   397‚Üíecho "- Build each modified function before committing"

#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail

# ===== Configuration =====
WORKSPACE_BASE="$HOME/socialaize-functions-workspace"

# ===== Helper Functions =====

log_info() { echo "‚ÑπÔ∏è  $*"; }
log_success() { echo "‚úÖ $*"; }
log_error() { echo "‚ùå Error: $*" >&2; }
log_warn() { echo "‚ö†Ô∏è  Warning: $*"; }

# Initialize submodules if present
initialize_submodules() {
  local path="$1"
  if [[ -f "$path/.gitmodules" ]]; then
    log_info "Initializing submodules..."
    (cd "$path" && git submodule update --init --recursive)
  fi
}

# Cleanup on failure
cleanup_on_failure() {
  log_error "Creation failed, rolling back..."

  # Remove all created worktrees
  for wt in "${CREATED_WORKTREES[@]}"; do
    [[ -d "$wt" ]] && git worktree remove "$wt" --force 2>/dev/null
  done

  # Remove workspace directory (with safety check)
  if [[ -n "${WORKSPACE_DIR:-}" ]] && [[ -d "$WORKSPACE_DIR" ]]; then
    if [[ "$WORKSPACE_DIR" == "$WORKSPACE_BASE/"* ]]; then
      rm -rf "$WORKSPACE_DIR"
    else
      log_error "Safety check failed: refusing to remove path outside WORKSPACE_BASE"
    fi
  fi

  log_info "Rollback complete"
  exit 1
}

trap cleanup_on_failure ERR INT TERM

# ===== Parse Arguments =====

PRIMARY_FUNCTION="${1:-}"
shift || true

RELATED_FUNCTIONS=()
CUSTOM_WORKSPACE_NAME=""

while [[ $# -gt 0 ]]; do
  case "$1" in
    --workspace-name)
      CUSTOM_WORKSPACE_NAME="$2"
      shift 2
      ;;
    *)
      RELATED_FUNCTIONS+=("$1")
      shift
      ;;
  esac
done

# ===== Validation =====

[[ -z "$PRIMARY_FUNCTION" ]] && {
  log_error "Primary function name is required"
  echo "Usage: /worktree-functions <primary-function> [related-functions...] [--workspace-name <name>]"
  exit 1
}

# Ensure we're in a git repo
git rev-parse --git-dir >/dev/null 2>&1 || {
  log_error "Not in a git repository"
  exit 1
}

# Set workspace name
if [[ -n "$CUSTOM_WORKSPACE_NAME" ]]; then
  WORKSPACE_NAME="$CUSTOM_WORKSPACE_NAME"
else
  WORKSPACE_NAME="$PRIMARY_FUNCTION"
fi

WORKSPACE_DIR="$WORKSPACE_BASE/$WORKSPACE_NAME"

# Check if workspace already exists
[[ -d "$WORKSPACE_DIR" ]] && {
  log_error "Workspace already exists: $WORKSPACE_DIR"
  log_info "Use --workspace-name with a different name or run: /cleanup-functions-workspace $WORKSPACE_NAME"
  exit 1
}

# Fetch from remote to ensure we have latest branches
log_info "Fetching from origin..."
git fetch origin 2>/dev/null || log_warn "Could not fetch from remote, using local branches"

# Validate all function branches exist
ALL_FUNCTIONS=("$PRIMARY_FUNCTION" "${RELATED_FUNCTIONS[@]}")

for func in "${ALL_FUNCTIONS[@]}"; do
  branch="functions-$func"

  # Check if branch exists locally or remotely
  if ! git show-ref --verify --quiet "refs/heads/$branch"; then
    # Not local, check remote
    if ! git ls-remote --heads origin "$branch" 2>/dev/null | grep -q "$branch"; then
      log_error "Branch '$branch' does not exist locally or remotely"
      echo ""
      echo "Available function branches:"
      git branch -r | grep "origin/functions-" | sed 's|.*/functions-||' | sed 's/^/  - /'
      exit 1
    else
      # Exists remotely but not locally - create tracking branch
      log_info "Creating local tracking branch for $branch"
      git branch --track "$branch" "origin/$branch" 2>/dev/null || true
    fi
  fi
done

# Warn about out-of-sync branches
for func in "${ALL_FUNCTIONS[@]}"; do
  branch="functions-$func"

  if git show-ref --verify --quiet "refs/heads/$branch"; then
    local_sha=$(git rev-parse "$branch" 2>/dev/null)
    remote_sha=$(git rev-parse "origin/$branch" 2>/dev/null || echo "")

    if [[ -n "$remote_sha" ]] && [[ "$local_sha" != "$remote_sha" ]]; then
      log_warn "Branch '$branch' is out of sync with remote"
      log_info "  Local:  $local_sha"
      log_info "  Remote: $remote_sha"
      log_info "  Consider: git pull origin $branch"
    fi
  fi
done

# ===== Create Workspace =====

log_info "Creating functions workspace: $WORKSPACE_NAME"
mkdir -p "$WORKSPACE_DIR"

CREATED_WORKTREES=()

# Create worktree for primary function
PRIMARY_PATH="$WORKSPACE_DIR/$PRIMARY_FUNCTION"
log_info "Creating worktree for primary function: $PRIMARY_FUNCTION"
git worktree add "$PRIMARY_PATH" "functions-$PRIMARY_FUNCTION"
CREATED_WORKTREES+=("$PRIMARY_PATH")

# Initialize submodules (using helper)
initialize_submodules "$PRIMARY_PATH"

# Create worktrees for related functions
for func in "${RELATED_FUNCTIONS[@]}"; do
  func_path="$WORKSPACE_DIR/$func"
  log_info "Creating worktree for related function: $func"
  git worktree add "$func_path" "functions-$func"
  CREATED_WORKTREES+=("$func_path")

  # Initialize submodules (using helper)
  initialize_submodules "$func_path"
done

# ===== Create Workspace Documentation =====

# Detect entry point for a function
detect_entry_point() {
  local func_path="$1"
  local func_name="$2"
  local possible_entries=(
    "src/main.ts"
    "src/main.js"
    "src/index.ts"
    "src/index.js"
    "main.ts"
    "index.ts"
  )

  for entry in "${possible_entries[@]}"; do
    if [[ -f "$func_path/functions/$func_name/$entry" ]]; then
      echo "$entry"
      return 0
    fi
  done

  echo "src/main.ts"  # fallback
}

# Detect package manager
detect_package_manager() {
  local func_path="$1"
  local func_name="$2"

  if [[ -f "$func_path/functions/$func_name/package-lock.json" ]]; then
    echo "npm"
  elif [[ -f "$func_path/functions/$func_name/pnpm-lock.yaml" ]]; then
    echo "pnpm"
  elif [[ -f "$func_path/functions/$func_name/yarn.lock" ]]; then
    echo "yarn"
  else
    echo "npm"  # default
  fi
}

# Create workspace README
cat > "$WORKSPACE_DIR/WORKSPACE_README.md" <<EOF
# Functions Workspace: ${WORKSPACE_NAME}

You are working in a multi-function workspace. Each function lives in its own worktree checked out from its dedicated branch.

## Workspace Structure

### Primary Function: ${PRIMARY_FUNCTION}
- **Path**: ${PRIMARY_PATH}
- **Branch**: functions-${PRIMARY_FUNCTION}
- **Function Code**: functions/${PRIMARY_FUNCTION}/
- **Main Entry**: $(detect_entry_point "$PRIMARY_PATH" "$PRIMARY_FUNCTION")
- **Package Manager**: $(detect_package_manager "$PRIMARY_PATH" "$PRIMARY_FUNCTION")

$(if [[ ${#RELATED_FUNCTIONS[@]} -gt 0 ]]; then
  echo "### Related Functions"
  for func in "${RELATED_FUNCTIONS[@]}"; do
    func_path="$WORKSPACE_DIR/$func"
    echo "${func_num:-1}. **${func}**"
    echo "   - Path: ${func_path}"
    echo "   - Branch: functions-${func}"
    echo "   - Function Code: functions/${func}/"
    echo "   - Main Entry: $(detect_entry_point "$func_path" "$func")"
    echo "   - Package Manager: $(detect_package_manager "$func_path" "$func")"
    echo ""
  done
fi)

## How to Work in This Workspace

### Reading Files
Use absolute paths from the workspace:

\`\`\`typescript
// Read primary function
Read("${PRIMARY_PATH}/functions/${PRIMARY_FUNCTION}/$(detect_entry_point "$PRIMARY_PATH" "$PRIMARY_FUNCTION")")

$(for func in "${RELATED_FUNCTIONS[@]}"; do
  func_path="$WORKSPACE_DIR/$func"
  echo "// Read ${func}"
  echo "Read(\"${func_path}/functions/${func}/$(detect_entry_point "$func_path" "$func")\")"
  echo ""
done)
\`\`\`

### Editing Files
Edit files in their respective worktree directories:

\`\`\`typescript
Edit(
  "${PRIMARY_PATH}/functions/${PRIMARY_FUNCTION}/src/handlers/example.ts",
  oldCode,
  newCode
)
\`\`\`

### Building Functions
Each function must be built in its own worktree:

\`\`\`bash
# Build ${PRIMARY_FUNCTION}
cd ${PRIMARY_PATH}
$(detect_package_manager "$PRIMARY_PATH" "$PRIMARY_FUNCTION") install  # First time only
$(detect_package_manager "$PRIMARY_PATH" "$PRIMARY_FUNCTION") run build

$(for func in "${RELATED_FUNCTIONS[@]}"; do
  func_path="$WORKSPACE_DIR/$func"
  pm=$(detect_package_manager "$func_path" "$func")
  echo "# Build ${func}"
  echo "cd ${func_path}"
  echo "$pm install  # First time only"
  echo "$pm run build"
  echo ""
done)
\`\`\`

### Testing Functions

\`\`\`bash
# Test ${PRIMARY_FUNCTION}
cd ${PRIMARY_PATH}
$(detect_package_manager "$PRIMARY_PATH" "$PRIMARY_FUNCTION") test

$(for func in "${RELATED_FUNCTIONS[@]}"; do
  func_path="$WORKSPACE_DIR/$func"
  pm=$(detect_package_manager "$func_path" "$func")
  echo "# Test ${func}"
  echo "cd ${func_path}"
  echo "$pm test"
  echo ""
done)
\`\`\`

### Committing Changes
**IMPORTANT**: Commit changes in each worktree separately to their respective branches.

\`\`\`bash
# Commit ${PRIMARY_FUNCTION} changes
cd ${PRIMARY_PATH}
git add functions/${PRIMARY_FUNCTION}/
git commit -m "feat(${PRIMARY_FUNCTION}): description"
git push origin functions-${PRIMARY_FUNCTION}

$(for func in "${RELATED_FUNCTIONS[@]}"; do
  func_path="$WORKSPACE_DIR/$func"
  echo "# Commit ${func} changes"
  echo "cd ${func_path}"
  echo "git add functions/${func}/"
  echo "git commit -m \"feat(${func}): description\""
  echo "git push origin functions-${func}"
  echo ""
done)
\`\`\`

### Creating Pull Requests
Create **separate PRs** for each function branch:

\`\`\`bash
# PR for ${PRIMARY_FUNCTION}
cd ${PRIMARY_PATH}
gh pr create --base main --head functions-${PRIMARY_FUNCTION} --title "feat(${PRIMARY_FUNCTION}): description"

$(for func in "${RELATED_FUNCTIONS[@]}"; do
  func_path="$WORKSPACE_DIR/$func"
  echo "# PR for ${func}"
  echo "cd ${func_path}"
  echo "gh pr create --base main --head functions-${func} --title \"feat(${func}): description\""
  echo ""
done)
\`\`\`

## Important Notes
- Each worktree is on a **DIFFERENT branch** (functions-FunctionName)
- Changes to one function do **NOT** affect others until merged
- After completing work, create **separate PRs** for each function branch
- **DO NOT push directly to main branch**
- Always build before committing to catch errors
- When done, clean up with: \`/cleanup-functions-workspace ${WORKSPACE_NAME}\`

## Quick Reference
- Workspace: ${WORKSPACE_DIR}
- Primary: ${PRIMARY_FUNCTION} ‚Üí ${PRIMARY_PATH}
$(for func in "${RELATED_FUNCTIONS[@]}"; do
  echo "- Related: ${func} ‚Üí ${WORKSPACE_DIR}/${func}"
done)

EOF

# Disable trap on successful completion
trap - ERR INT TERM

# ===== Output Success =====

echo ""
log_success "Functions workspace created!"
echo ""
echo "üì¶ Workspace: $WORKSPACE_NAME"
echo "üìÅ Location: $WORKSPACE_DIR"
echo ""
echo "üéØ Primary Function: $PRIMARY_FUNCTION"
echo "   Branch: functions-$PRIMARY_FUNCTION"
echo "   Path: $PRIMARY_PATH/functions/$PRIMARY_FUNCTION/"
echo ""

if [[ ${#RELATED_FUNCTIONS[@]} -gt 0 ]]; then
  echo "üîó Related Functions:"
  for func in "${RELATED_FUNCTIONS[@]}"; do
    echo "   ‚Ä¢ $func (functions-$func)"
    echo "     Path: $WORKSPACE_DIR/$func/functions/$func/"
  done
  echo ""
fi

echo "üìã Context loaded for Claude:"
echo "   ‚Ä¢ Workspace README: WORKSPACE_README.md"
echo "   ‚Ä¢ Build/commit instructions ready"
echo ""
echo "üí° How to use:"
echo "1. Claude can now read/edit files across all function worktrees"
echo "2. Each function builds independently: cd <function-path> && npm run build"
echo "3. Commit changes per-function (separate branches)"
echo "4. Create separate PRs for each modified function"
echo ""
echo "‚ö†Ô∏è  Remember:"
echo "- Changes in one worktree don't affect others"
echo "- Each function is on its own branch (functions-FunctionName)"
echo "- Build each modified function before committing"
echo "- Push changes before creating PRs"
echo ""
echo "üßπ Cleanup when done:"
echo "   /cleanup-functions-workspace $WORKSPACE_NAME"
echo ""

#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail

log_info() { echo "‚ÑπÔ∏è  $*"; }
log_success() { echo "‚úÖ $*"; }
log_error() { echo "‚ùå Error: $*" >&2; }

WORKSPACE_NAME="${1:-}"
FORCE="${2:-}"

[[ -z "$WORKSPACE_NAME" ]] && {
  log_error "Workspace name is required"
  echo "Usage: /cleanup-functions-workspace <workspace-name> [--force]"
  exit 1
}

WORKSPACE_DIR="$HOME/socialaize-functions-workspace/$WORKSPACE_NAME"

[[ ! -d "$WORKSPACE_DIR" ]] && {
  log_error "Workspace does not exist: $WORKSPACE_DIR"
  exit 1
}

# Get all worktree paths in workspace
worktree_paths=()
for dir in "$WORKSPACE_DIR"/*/; do
  [[ -d "$dir" ]] && worktree_paths+=("$dir")
done

[[ ${#worktree_paths[@]} -eq 0 ]] && {
  log_error "No worktrees found in workspace"
  exit 1
}

# Safety checks (skip if --force)
if [[ "$FORCE" != "--force" ]]; then
  has_issues=false

  for wt_path in "${worktree_paths[@]}"; do
    func_name=$(basename "$wt_path")

    # Use subshell to avoid changing directory state
    (
      cd "$wt_path"

      # Check uncommitted changes
      if [[ -n "$(git status --porcelain)" ]]; then
        echo "‚ùå $func_name: Has uncommitted changes"
        has_issues=true
      fi

      # Check unpushed commits
      if remote_sha=$(git rev-parse "@{u}" 2>/dev/null); then
        local_sha=$(git rev-parse HEAD)
        if [[ "$local_sha" != "$remote_sha" ]]; then
          unpushed=$(git log "@{u}..HEAD" --oneline | wc -l | tr -d ' ')
          if [[ $unpushed -gt 0 ]]; then
            echo "‚ùå $func_name: Has $unpushed unpushed commit(s)"
            has_issues=true
          fi
        fi
      fi
    )
  done

  if $has_issues; then
    echo ""
    log_error "Cannot cleanup workspace due to uncommitted/unpushed changes"
    echo "Options:"
    echo "  1. Commit and push changes in each function"
    echo "  2. Use --force to cleanup anyway (‚ö†Ô∏è  changes will be lost)"
    exit 1
  fi
fi

# Remove all worktrees
log_info "Cleaning up workspace: $WORKSPACE_NAME"
for wt_path in "${worktree_paths[@]}"; do
  func_name=$(basename "$wt_path")
  log_info "Removing worktree: $func_name"
  git worktree remove "$wt_path" || git worktree remove "$wt_path" --force
done

# Remove workspace directory (with safety check)
if [[ "$WORKSPACE_DIR" == "$HOME/socialaize-functions-workspace/"* ]]; then
  rm -rf "$WORKSPACE_DIR"
else
  log_error "Safety check failed: refusing to remove path outside expected workspace base"
  exit 1
fi

log_success "Workspace removed: $WORKSPACE_NAME"

1. **list-worktrees.sh (line 18-19)**: Only shows branches matching `^feature/` pattern

4. **worktree-status.sh**: No issues - it just uses whatever branch is checked out
5. **worktree-functions.sh**: Works with `functions-` prefix, which is separate from feature branches

The core problem is:
- `list-worktrees.sh` filters for branches starting with `feature/` 
- `worktree-feature.sh` creates new branches with `feature/` prefix
- But users can have branches with any pattern like `feat-`, `fix-`, etc.

The solution:
1. **list-worktrees.sh**: Remove the `feature/` filter entirely. Show ALL worktrees that exist in the worktree base directory, regardless of branch name.
2. **worktree-feature.sh**: Don't create branches with `feature/` prefix automatically. Only create branches when user wants a new branch (and they can specify the full name).
3. **cleanup-worktree.sh**: Fix the fallback logic to not assume branch pattern.

#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail

log_info() { echo "‚ÑπÔ∏è  $*"; }

echo "üìã Active Worktrees:"
echo ""

# Parse git worktree list
feature_count=0
main_path=$(git rev-parse --show-toplevel 2>/dev/null || echo "")

while IFS= read -r line; do
  if [[ "$line" =~ ^worktree[[:space:]](.+)$ ]]; then
    wt_path="${BASH_REMATCH[1]}"

    # Skip main repo
    [[ "$wt_path" == "$main_path" ]] && continue

    # FIXED: Consume the HEAD line before reading branch
    IFS= read -r head_line

    # Now read branch line
    IFS= read -r branch_line
    if [[ "$branch_line" =~ ^branch[[:space:]]refs/heads/(.+)$ ]]; then
      branch="${BASH_REMATCH[1]}"

      # Check if this is a feature worktree
      if [[ "$branch" =~ ^feature/ ]]; then
        feature_count=$((feature_count + 1))

        # Get feature name
        feature_name=$(basename "$wt_path" | sed 's/^feature-//')

        # Get port if exists
        port=""
        if [[ -f "$wt_path/.env.local" ]]; then
          port=$(grep -E "^PORT=" "$wt_path/.env.local" 2>/dev/null | cut -d= -f2 | tr -d ' ' || echo "")
        fi

        # Check if port is in use (prefer nc, fallback lsof)
        port_status="‚ö™Ô∏è"
        if [[ -n "$port" ]]; then
          if command -v nc >/dev/null 2>&1; then
            if nc -z localhost "$port" 2>/dev/null; then
              port_status="üü¢"
            fi
          elif command -v lsof >/dev/null 2>&1; then
            if lsof -Pi ":$port" -sTCP:LISTEN -t >/dev/null 2>&1; then
              port_status="üü¢"
            fi
          fi
        fi

        # Check if path exists
        if [[ -d "$wt_path" ]]; then
          echo "  ‚úÖ $feature_name $(if [[ -n "$port" ]]; then echo "($port_status port $port)"; fi)"
        else
          echo "  ‚ùå $feature_name (path missing)"
        fi

        echo "    Branch: $branch"
        echo "    Path: $wt_path"
        echo ""
      fi
    fi
  fi
done < <(git worktree list --porcelain)

[[ $feature_count -eq 0 ]] && echo "No feature worktrees found."
echo ""

# List function workspaces
workspace_base="$HOME/socialaize-functions-workspace"

#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail

log_info() { echo "‚ÑπÔ∏è  $*"; }

echo "üìã Active Worktrees:"
echo ""

# Parse git worktree list
feature_count=0
main_path=$(git rev-parse --show-toplevel 2>/dev/null || echo "")

while IFS= read -r line; do
  if [[ "$line" =~ ^worktree[[:space:]](.+)$ ]]; then
    wt_path="${BASH_REMATCH[1]}"

    # Skip main repo
    [[ "$wt_path" == "$main_path" ]] && continue

    # FIXED: Consume the HEAD line before reading branch
    IFS= read -r head_line

    # Now read branch line
    IFS= read -r branch_line
    if [[ "$branch_line" =~ ^branch[[:space:]]refs/heads/(.+)$ ]]; then
      branch="${BASH_REMATCH[1]}"

      # Check if this is a feature worktree
      if [[ "$branch" =~ ^feature/ ]]; then
        feature_count=$((feature_count + 1))

        # Get feature name
        feature_name=$(basename "$wt_path" | sed 's/^feature-//')

        # Get port if exists
        port=""
        if [[ -f "$wt_path/.env.local" ]]; then
          port=$(grep -E "^PORT=" "$wt_path/.env.local" 2>/dev/null | cut -d= -f2 | tr -d ' ' || echo "")
        fi

        # Check if port is in use (prefer nc, fallback lsof)
        port_status="‚ö™Ô∏è"
        if [[ -n "$port" ]]; then
          if command -v nc >/dev/null 2>&1; then
            if nc -z localhost "$port" 2>/dev/null; then
              port_status="üü¢"
            fi
          elif command -v lsof >/dev/null 2>&1; then
            if lsof -Pi ":$port" -sTCP:LISTEN -t >/dev/null 2>&1; then
              port_status="üü¢"
            fi
          fi
        fi

        # Check if path exists
        if [[ -d "$wt_path" ]]; then
          echo "  ‚úÖ $feature_name $(if [[ -n "$port" ]]; then echo "($port_status port $port)"; fi)"
        else
          echo "  ‚ùå $feature_name (path missing)"
        fi

        echo "    Branch: $branch"
        echo "    Path: $wt_path"
        echo ""
      fi
    fi
  fi
done < <(git worktree list --porcelain)

[[ $feature_count -eq 0 ]] && echo "No feature worktrees found."
echo ""

# List function workspaces
workspace_base="$HOME/socialaize-functions-workspace"
if [[ -d "$workspace_base" ]]; then
  workspaces=($(ls -1 "$workspace_base" 2>/dev/null || echo ""))

  if [[ ${#workspaces[@]} -gt 0 ]]; then
    echo "Function Workspaces:"
    for ws in "${workspaces[@]}"; do
      ws_path="$workspace_base/$ws"

      if [[ -f "$ws_path/WORKSPACE_README.md" ]]; then
        # Extract primary function from README

        # Count related functions

        echo "  ‚Ä¢ $ws"

        [[ $related_count -gt 0 ]] && echo "    Related functions: $related_count"
      else
        echo "  ‚Ä¢ $ws (no metadata)"
      fi
      echo ""
    done
  fi
fi

echo "üí° Commands:"
echo "  /cleanup-worktree <name>              - Remove a feature worktree"
echo "  /cleanup-functions-workspace <name>   - Remove a function workspace"
echo "  /worktree-status <name>               - Show detailed status"

#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail

# ===== Configuration =====
WORKTREE_BASE="$HOME/socialaize-worktrees"
PORT_MIN=6943
PORT_MAX=7020
MAIN_BRANCH="main"
LOCK_FILE="/tmp/socialaize-worktree-port.lock"

# ===== Helper Functions =====

log_info() { echo "‚ÑπÔ∏è  $*"; }
log_success() { echo "‚úÖ $*"; }
log_error() { echo "‚ùå Error: $*" >&2; }
log_warn() { echo "‚ö†Ô∏è  Warning: $*"; }

# Initialize submodules if present
initialize_submodules() {
  local path="$1"
  if [[ -f "$path/.gitmodules" ]]; then
    log_info "Initializing submodules..."
    (cd "$path" && git submodule update --init --recursive)
  fi
}

# Get next available port by scanning existing worktrees (RACE-CONDITION SAFE)
get_next_port() {
  # Acquire exclusive lock - only one process can run this at a time
  (
    # Try flock first, fallback to mkdir
    if command -v flock >/dev/null 2>&1; then
      flock -n 200 || {
        log_error "Another worktree is being created. Please wait and retry."
        return 1
      }
    else
      # Fallback: atomic mkdir lock
      local lock_dir="/tmp/socialaize-worktree.lock"
      # Set trap BEFORE attempting mkdir to ensure cleanup
      trap 'rmdir "$lock_dir" 2>/dev/null' EXIT RETURN

      if ! mkdir "$lock_dir" 2>/dev/null; then
        log_error "Another worktree is being created. Please wait and retry."
        exit 1  # Use exit instead of return to trigger trap
      fi
    fi

    # === CRITICAL SECTION START ===
    local used_ports=()

    # Scan all worktrees for .env.local files
    while IFS= read -r line; do
      if [[ "$line" =~ ^worktree[[:space:]](.+)$ ]]; then
        local wt_path="${BASH_REMATCH[1]}"
        if [[ -f "$wt_path/.env.local" ]]; then
          local port=$(grep -E "^PORT=" "$wt_path/.env.local" 2>/dev/null | cut -d= -f2 | tr -d ' ')
          [[ -n "$port" ]] && used_ports+=("$port")
        fi
      fi
    done < <(git worktree list --porcelain)

    # Find first available port
    for port in $(seq $PORT_MIN $PORT_MAX); do
      # Check if port is in used_ports array (optimized with grep)
      if [[ ${#used_ports[@]} -gt 0 ]] && printf '%s\n' "${used_ports[@]}" | grep -q -w "$port"; then
        continue
      fi

      # Optional: Check if port is actually in use (prefer nc, fallback lsof)
      if command -v nc >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        if nc -z localhost "$port" 2>/dev/null; then
          continue
        fi
      elif command -v lsof >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        if lsof -Pi ":$port" -sTCP:LISTEN -t >/dev/null 2>&1; then
          continue
        fi
      fi

      echo "$port"
      return 0
    done

    log_error "No available ports in range $PORT_MIN-$PORT_MAX"
    return 1
    # === CRITICAL SECTION END ===

  ) 200>"$LOCK_FILE"
}

# Cleanup on failure
cleanup_on_failure() {
  log_error "Creation failed, rolling back..."

  # Remove worktree if created (with safety check)
  [[ -n "${WORKTREE_DIR:-}" ]] && [[ -d "$WORKTREE_DIR" ]] && {
    # Safety: ensure we're deleting inside WORKTREE_BASE
    if [[ "$WORKTREE_DIR" == "$WORKTREE_BASE/"* ]]; then
      git worktree remove "$WORKTREE_DIR" --force 2>/dev/null || rm -rf "$WORKTREE_DIR"
    else
      log_error "Safety check failed: refusing to remove path outside WORKTREE_BASE: $WORKTREE_DIR"
    fi
  }

  # Remove branch if we created it
  [[ -n "${CREATED_BRANCH:-}" ]] && [[ "$CREATED_BRANCH" == "true" ]] && {
    git branch -D "$BRANCH_NAME" 2>/dev/null || true
  }

  log_info "Rollback complete"
  exit 1
}

trap cleanup_on_failure ERR INT TERM

# ===== Parse Arguments =====
FEATURE_NAME="${1:-}"
shift || true

EXISTING_BRANCH=""
TYPE="fullstack"
CUSTOM_PORT=""

while [[ $# -gt 0 ]]; do
  case "$1" in
    --existing-branch)
      EXISTING_BRANCH="$2"
      shift 2
      ;;
    --type)
      TYPE="$2"
      shift 2
      ;;
    --port)
      CUSTOM_PORT="$2"
      shift 2
      ;;
    *)
      log_error "Unknown option: $1"
      exit 1
      ;;
  esac
done

# ===== Validation =====

[[ -z "$FEATURE_NAME" ]] && {
  log_error "Feature name is required"
  echo "Usage: /worktree-feature <feature-name> [--existing-branch <branch>] [--type <frontend|backend|fullstack>] [--port <port>]"
  exit 1
}

# Validate feature name (alphanumeric, hyphens, underscores only)
[[ ! "$FEATURE_NAME" =~ ^[a-zA-Z0-9_-]+$ ]] && {
  log_error "Feature name must contain only letters, numbers, hyphens, and underscores"
  exit 1
}

# Validate type
[[ ! "$TYPE" =~ ^(frontend|backend|fullstack)$ ]] && {
  log_error "Type must be one of: frontend, backend, fullstack"
  exit 1
}

# Ensure we're in a git repo
git rev-parse --git-dir >/dev/null 2>&1 || {
  log_error "Not in a git repository"
  exit 1
}

# Set branch name and validate
if [[ -n "$EXISTING_BRANCH" ]]; then
  # Validate branch name format (security)
  if [[ ! "$EXISTING_BRANCH" =~ ^[a-zA-Z0-9/_-]+$ ]]; then
    log_error "Invalid branch name format. Use only: letters, numbers, hyphens, slashes, underscores"
    exit 1
  fi

  BRANCH_NAME="$EXISTING_BRANCH"
  CREATED_BRANCH="false"

  # Fetch latest remote branches
  log_info "Fetching from origin..."
  git fetch origin 2>/dev/null || log_warn "Could not fetch from remote"

  # Check if branch exists locally OR remotely
  local_exists=false
  remote_exists=false

  if git show-ref --verify --quiet "refs/heads/$BRANCH_NAME"; then
    local_exists=true
  fi

  if git ls-remote --heads origin "$BRANCH_NAME" 2>/dev/null | grep -q "$BRANCH_NAME"; then
    remote_exists=true
  fi

  if [[ "$local_exists" == false ]] && [[ "$remote_exists" == false ]]; then
    log_error "Branch '$BRANCH_NAME' does not exist locally or remotely"
    exit 1
  fi

else
  BRANCH_NAME="feature/${FEATURE_NAME}"
  CREATED_BRANCH="true"
fi

# Set worktree directory
WORKTREE_DIR="$WORKTREE_BASE/feature-${FEATURE_NAME}"

# Check if worktree directory already exists
[[ -d "$WORKTREE_DIR" ]] && {
  log_error "Worktree directory already exists: $WORKTREE_DIR"
  exit 1
}

# Validate custom port
if [[ -n "$CUSTOM_PORT" ]]; then
  [[ ! "$CUSTOM_PORT" =~ ^[0-9]+$ ]] && {
    log_error "Port must be a number"
    exit 1
  }

  [[ "$CUSTOM_PORT" -lt 3000 || "$CUSTOM_PORT" -gt 9999 ]] && {
    log_error "Port must be between 3000-9999"
    exit 1
  }

  # Check if port is in use (prefer nc)
  if command -v nc >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    if nc -z localhost "$CUSTOM_PORT" 2>/dev/null; then
      log_error "Port $CUSTOM_PORT is already in use"
      exit 1
    fi
  elif command -v lsof >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    if lsof -Pi ":$CUSTOM_PORT" -sTCP:LISTEN -t >/dev/null 2>&1; then
      log_error "Port $CUSTOM_PORT is already in use"
      exit 1
    fi
  fi

  PORT="$CUSTOM_PORT"
else
  # Auto-assign port for frontend/fullstack
  if [[ "$TYPE" != "backend" ]]; then
    PORT=$(get_next_port) || exit 1
    log_info "Auto-assigned port: $PORT"
  else
    PORT=""
  fi
fi

# ===== Create Worktree =====

log_info "Creating worktree for feature: $FEATURE_NAME"

# Ensure parent directory exists
mkdir -p "$WORKTREE_BASE"

# Create worktree (FIXED: handle remote-only branches properly)
if [[ "$CREATED_BRANCH" == "true" ]]; then
  # New branch from origin/main
  log_info "Creating new branch: $BRANCH_NAME"
  git worktree add -b "$BRANCH_NAME" "$WORKTREE_DIR" "origin/$MAIN_BRANCH"
else
  # Existing branch - handle local vs remote-only properly
  if [[ "$local_exists" == true ]]; then
    # Local branch exists - just check it out
    log_info "Checking out existing local branch: $BRANCH_NAME"
    git worktree add "$WORKTREE_DIR" "$BRANCH_NAME"
  else
    # Remote-only branch - create local tracking branch FIRST
    log_info "Creating local tracking branch for remote: $BRANCH_NAME"
    git branch --track "$BRANCH_NAME" "origin/$BRANCH_NAME"
    git worktree add "$WORKTREE_DIR" "$BRANCH_NAME"
  fi
fi

# Initialize submodules if present (using helper)
initialize_submodules "$WORKTREE_DIR"

# ===== Configure Worktree =====

# Use subshell to avoid changing directory state
(
  cd "$WORKTREE_DIR"

  # Create .env.local with port (if applicable)
  if [[ -n "$PORT" ]]; then
    cat > .env.local <<EOF
# Worktree-specific configuration
PORT=$PORT
WORKTREE_NAME=$FEATURE_NAME
WORKTREE_TYPE=$TYPE
EOF

    log_success "Created .env.local with PORT=$PORT"
  fi

  # Symlink shared .env from main repo (if it exists)
  MAIN_REPO_PATH=$(git rev-parse --show-toplevel 2>/dev/null || echo "")
  if [[ -n "$MAIN_REPO_PATH" ]] && [[ -f "$MAIN_REPO_PATH/.env" ]]; then
    ln -sf "$MAIN_REPO_PATH/.env" .env.shared
    log_info "Symlinked .env.shared from main repo"
  fi

  # Add to .gitignore (optimized with loop)
  touch .gitignore
  for item in ".env.local" ".env.shared" "WORKTREE_README.md" "*.code-workspace"; do
    grep -qxF "$item" .gitignore 2>/dev/null || echo "$item" >> .gitignore
  done

  # Add pnpm script for dev:worktree (only if not already there)
  if [[ -n "$PORT" ]] && ! grep -q "dev:worktree" package.json 2>/dev/null; then
    pnpm pkg set "scripts.dev:worktree=astro dev --port \${PORT:-6942}" 2>/dev/null || {
      log_warn "Could not add dev:worktree script to package.json"
    }
  fi

  # Create WORKTREE_README.md
  cat > WORKTREE_README.md <<EOF
# Feature: ${FEATURE_NAME}

## Worktree Info
- **Branch**: ${BRANCH_NAME}
- **Type**: ${TYPE}
$(if [[ -n "$PORT" ]]; then echo "- **Port**: ${PORT}"; fi)
- **Created**: $(date -u +"%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S UTC")
- **Path**: ${WORKTREE_DIR}

## Quick Start

### Development
$(if [[ -n "$PORT" ]]; then
  echo "\`\`\`bash
# Start dev server (uses PORT from .env.local)
pnpm dev:worktree

# Or manually specify port
pnpm dev -- --port ${PORT}
\`\`\`"
else
  echo "\`\`\`bash
# Backend - no dev server needed
pnpm test
\`\`\`"
fi)

### Commands
- **Run tests**: \`pnpm test\`
- **Type check**: \`pnpm run typecheck\`
- **Build**: \`pnpm build\`

### Environment Variables
$(if [[ -n "$PORT" ]]; then
  echo "- **.env.local**: Worktree-specific (PORT, WORKTREE_NAME)"
fi)
- **.env.shared**: Symlink to main repo's .env (shared secrets, read-only)
- **Never commit .env.local or .env.shared**

## Merging Back

1. **Ensure tests pass**:
   \`\`\`bash
   pnpm test
   pnpm run typecheck
   \`\`\`

2. **Check for uncommitted changes**:
   \`\`\`bash
   git status
   \`\`\`

3. **Push to remote**:
   \`\`\`bash
   git push origin ${BRANCH_NAME}
   \`\`\`

4. **Create PR**:
   \`\`\`bash
   gh pr create --base main --head ${BRANCH_NAME}
   # Or manually at: https://github.com/YOUR_ORG/socialaize/compare/${BRANCH_NAME}
   \`\`\`

5. **After merge, cleanup**:
   \`\`\`bash
   # From main repo:
   /cleanup-worktree ${FEATURE_NAME}
   # Or manually:
   git worktree remove ${WORKTREE_DIR}
   \`\`\`

## Safety Notes
- ‚ö†Ô∏è DO NOT push directly to main
- ‚ö†Ô∏è Each worktree is independent - changes won't sync automatically
- ‚ö†Ô∏è Shared .env is read-only (symlink) - don't modify in worktree

## Appwrite Functions
If working on functions, remember:
- Each function lives in \`functions-FunctionName\` branch
- Use \`/worktree-functions\` command if you need to modify multiple functions

EOF

  # Create VS Code workspace file
  if [[ -n "$PORT" ]]; then
    cat > "${FEATURE_NAME}.code-workspace" <<EOF
{
  "folders": [
    {
      "path": ".",
      "name": "Feature: ${FEATURE_NAME}"
    }
  ],
  "settings": {
    "astro.devPort": ${PORT},
    "files.exclude": {
      "node_modules": true
    }
  },
  "extensions": {
    "recommendations": [
      "astro-build.astro-vscode",
      "vue.volar"
    ]
  }
}
EOF
  fi
)

# Disable trap on successful completion
trap - ERR INT TERM

# ===== Output Success =====

echo ""
log_success "Worktree created successfully!"
echo ""
echo "üìÅ Location: $WORKTREE_DIR"
echo "üåø Branch: $BRANCH_NAME"
[[ -n "$PORT" ]] && echo "üîå Dev Server Port: $PORT"
echo ""
echo "üöÄ Next Steps:"
echo "1. Open new Claude Code session: code $WORKTREE_DIR"
[[ -n "$PORT" ]] && echo "   Or open workspace: code $WORKTREE_DIR/${FEATURE_NAME}.code-workspace"
[[ -n "$PORT" ]] && echo "2. Start dev server: cd $WORKTREE_DIR && pnpm dev:worktree"
[[ -z "$PORT" ]] && echo "2. Run tests: cd $WORKTREE_DIR && pnpm test"
echo "3. Begin development on feature: $FEATURE_NAME"
echo ""
echo "üí° Tips:"
echo "- See WORKTREE_README.md for full instructions"
[[ -n "$PORT" ]] && echo "- .env.local contains PORT=$PORT"
echo "- .env.shared is symlinked from main repo (read-only)"
echo ""
